content: i ve made little yarn circles either using crochet or emily ocker s magic knit circular cast on instead of buttons the original knitty pattern on ravelry has thousands of projects you can look through for ideas finishing remove the rescue row if you haven t already done so weave in the ends and take some great pictures post your project to ravelry and give a great gift there are several mini-tutorials on the following pages hat #43 fish adult size v1 2 mini tutorial 3 needle bind off 1 one front/back k2tog has been completed 2 needle thru front and back stitches preparing to make another front/back k2tog 3 two front/back k2tog stitches have been completed 4 take 2nd stitch on right needle & pull it over the 1st stitch 5 completing the bind off 6 one stitch is left repeat to bind off the rest of the stitches mini-tutorial - picking up the first column of stitches on the fin 1 scrap yarn placed to show where the 2 columns are where we re going to pick up stitches 2 legs of 2 stitches picked up with smaller gauge dpn 3 12 stitches picked up 4 transferring the picked up stitches onto long circular needle 5 stitches all transferred to the long circular needle 6 circular needle pulled so that the picked up stitches are on the cord of the circular needle hat #43 fish adult size v1 2 mini-tutorial picking up the second column of stitches on the fin 1 one stitch picked up using dpn 2 second stitch picked up with help from small needle 3 third stitch picked up with help from small needle 4 twelve stitches picked up and on dpn 5 transferring picked up stitches from dpn onto the circular needle which already has first column of stitches on it 6 two columns of picked up stitches on circular needle ready to be worked using magic loop method mini tutorial working the first round on the fins although you are using the magic loop method of pulling the back needle out you are really working each side separately round 1 side a round 1 side b etc fin color yarn in this case black being added and working the first half side a of the first round 2 side a of round 1 is done waiting to work side b 3 both sides of round 1 have been done so all of the stitches are now in black
